intro.p: Complete the three tasks below. Clearly mark which of your sketches lines up with each task.

content.p: Sketch the graph of the inverse of the following function.

image.description: a one to one function in red.r

outtro.p: The graph of the inverse is the reflection of the original graph over the line y = x. The original function is here in red, the inverse is in blue, and the dashed line is y = x.

image.description: a one to one function in red, a dashed line along the diagonal, and the relection of the red graph over the diagonal line in blue.

content.p: Consider the functions f(x) = {{f}} and g(t) = {{g}}. Using the following information to determine if f and g are inverses of each other.

outtro.p: You can check to see if they are inverses by composing the functions together and seeing if they cancel out. Since f(g(t)) = {{fg}} and g(f(x)) = {{gf}}, we know that {{answer_2}}.
The inverse is calculated by first writing y = {{h}}, then swapping x and y, and then solving for y. After you do that, you should get h^{-1}(x) = {{h_inv}}.
